body.name: Dickies Men's Relaxed Straight Fit Lightweight Duck Carpenter Jean
features: DURABLE STYLE: One of our most popular carpenter jeans. Soft garment-washed lightweight 100% cotton, deep front/back pockets, a utility pocket & left leg hammer loop. Relaxed fit gives room for bending, stooping & kneeling. Sits slightly below the waist.

SUPERIOR CONSTRUCTION: These rugged jeans feature a classic 5 pocket styling that includes a coin pocket & signature stitching on the back pockets for the timeless Dickies look. The straight leg fits over boots.

QUALITY DENIMWEAR: Our popular line of rugged jeans are ready to work or play in any situation with classic style featuring triple-stitched seams for extra durability, brass rivets that prevent rips at stress points, & fail-proof heavy duty brass zippers

TRUSTED NAME: The world's leading performance workwear brand, Dickies has been making quality workwear & apparel since 1922. All Dickies clothing offers superior craftsmanship & unmatched value to deliver classic style & long-lasting comfort every day.
We make jeans, outerwear, school & work uniforms, sports shirts, kids wear, hats, socks, underwear, boots, gloves, belts, eyewear, backpacks, bags & much more.
body.description: Dickies mens Relaxed Straight-fit Lightweight Duck Carpenter Jean

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I got these for my son in law as a birthday gift with a few other things for work. He is so tall and thin. These fit him exactly as he needed them too. Great buy, packed well and arrived as promised.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Slightly tight on thighs, but worth it.
reviews.reviewText: Fit almost as well as the rest of my carpenter jeans, they are a little tighter than I am used to in the thigh area. Waist-wise it fits perfectly, I don't have to worry about my tool belt pulling my pants down. It's a nice color, doesn't stain much and is thick enough to keep you warm without overheating you. They fit perfectly around my boots without being too tight. 9/10 would recommend grabbing a pair for this fall season.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality, long in the length
reviews.reviewText: Having never work Dickies jeans I didn't know what to expect for size. I went off of my Levi 559 size. The waist was almost perfect, a little loose like it is a half size to big. I'm caught in the middle between 31 and 32. The length however was about 2 inches to long. Washing did not help so I hemmed them up. I like the heavier fabric compared to the paper thin Levis I have been getting. It's heavier but still soft. And the relaxed fit is nice but not baggy. Looks good in the waist and hips. I also don't like droopy crotches and Dickies pass this nicely. I will definitely be changing over to Dickies brand from now on. I'm 63, been wearing Levis since I was a yonker and have become increasingly disappointed with the quality. I also don't like pre stressed clothes or that dirty brown look. Looks like they were worn in the oil field and stains have set in. At times, that is all I can find in my size 32 x 34 at Levi outlet. I can no longer depend on 501's unwashed to fit consistently. Legs to tight, waste to big, fabric thickness varies. So sad to see Levi quality diminish over time. There was a time I could buy 10 pair of 501 unwashed and every pair fit like the next. Can't say that now. Dickies, keep building a good product and I will be faithful to the brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Comfortable, Great value, Glad I found a Style of Dickies that Actually Fits Correctly
reviews.reviewText: I love these work pants. They fit as expected. They are a good mid-weight - not too heavy or rigid, but still tough and good for year round wear. Pretty darn durable as well. I bought my first pair of these on Amazon a little over a year ago. I wear them quite frequently for work, and they have held up great. Dickies are usually a great value, but I have had issues in the past finding the right size with some Dickies styles -which is incidentally my biggest complaint about Dickies, overall. There seems to be no consistency from style to style (or even sometimes with differing colors of the same style) regarding sizing and fit for Dickies pants. The styles of Dickies that Walmart carries seem to run about a size and a half too small. I typically wear 34x30, and I couldn't button the Wal-Mart Dickies in that size with a pair of vice grips. However, the 36x30 in the same style are way too baggy for me. I also had the same problem with the first pair of Dickies I tried from Amazon - https://smile.amazon.com/Dickies-Mens-Relaxed-Duck-34x30/dp/B000PSVEUW/ref=sr_1_1?s=apparel&ie=UTF8&qid=1490228952&sr=1-1&nodeID=7147441011&psd=1&keywords=Dickies%2BMen's%2BRelaxed%2BFit%2BDuck%2BJean%2C%2BMoss%2C%2B34x30&th=1&psc=1. Luckily, I found these that actually do fit, and I have been extremely pleased.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good work pants for warmer weather
reviews.reviewText: I like Dickies, but wanted something a bit thinner and softer than classic carpenter pants. These do the job. The only thing is I have a big weightlifter booty, so the waistband is to loose because I have to get a bigger size to fit the rest of me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Small pocket openings and side pocket not for a larger cell phone
reviews.reviewText: Pant size is 38x34, relaxed fit carpenter duck jean. Straight leg. Rear pockets are huge. Tool loop as well. Too bad the trend doesn’t continue.The front pockets are small, the opening is as well. With sweaty swollen hands, I work construction, this won’t be very accessible. The side pocket is small as well. No, I don’t want a cargo pant. I have a Iphone13 pro max, the case is a otterbox defender. Fitting isn’t even close. Sure would be handy not to have to use a case holder appendage or put the phone in a bending area just to have it on me. So no, front or back pocket isn’t a good spot while working, talking physical labor not walking around. I’ve been using the side pocket on pants since cell phones. This isn’t some new invention. Carhartt pants fit my phone snugly, no worries on the motorcycle. Otherwise the pants fit fine. Just don’t expect big roomy front pockets or a cellphone holding side pocket. Bummer, I really liked these pants.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Versatile, work or casual

reviews.reviewText: Los materiales, acabados, costuras son de 10. El color que me mandaron no es el que pedí, pero si me gustó. La talla a mí me queda algo grande, no uso con cinturón, no tengo pega porque no hay 29. Lo único que no me gustó mucho es lo olgado de los pies, a mi gusto solo se ven bien con botas de trabajo y creo que va acorde a porque están pensados para trabajo. Me gusta algo más versátil, suelo usar mucho tenis casual.

Perfect work pants. Canvas fabric feels lighter than other brand's duck work pants. My cell phone fits snugly in the side pocket, just wish there was a flap or some type of closure for the pocket. 34" waist 32" length perfect.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente calidad de fabricación y materiales
reviews.reviewText: 100% original, el único detalle es que está un poco reducida la talla tengo otros de otra marca des tallas más chicos y están del mismo tamaño

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is another killer jeans from Dickies - perfect fit, length and room down the leg. Made with duck cotton so you know it's tough wearing. Just be mindful that this is the lightweight version of the carpenter jeans - as far as I am aware, Dickies make two version of these jeans - a 12 ounce duck cotton version and this, made with 9 ounce duck - so a lot lighter - perfect for late spring/summer/early autumn whereas the 12 ounce is for winter - I have both version and can confirm the weigh difference - I actually prefer these Dickies over the Carhartt equivalent
